NEWS STORY
10/12/1998 08:38:00
w1239 wstm- r i BC-HongKong-BabyFoodReca 10-12 0138
BC-Hong Kong-Baby Food Recall
Distributor recalls batches of Heinz baby food
HONG KONG (AP) _ Two batches of Heinz baby food have been recalled in Hong Kong following a similar action in the United States over worries they may contain high levels of lead, the Health Department said Monday. A statement said 14,000 jars of 4-ounce (110 gram) Vegetable Chicken Dinner and 2.5-ounce (70 gram) Beginner Strained Carrots were being recalled by the distributor in the territory. It said the department has also taken some samples of Heinz products for further testing. Last week, Heinz officials in the United States said the traces of lead pose little health risks. The problem was discovered in a routine Food and Drug Administration review of supermarket shelves. No illnesses have been reported.
(PROFILE (WS SL:BC-Hong Kong-Baby Food (REG:ASIA;) (REG:ENGL;) (REG:EURO;) (REG:BRIT;) (REG:SCAN;) (LANG:ENGLISH;)) )
